oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Randomized clinical trial evaluating the effects of the administration of acidogenic boluses on the day prior to dry off on dairy cow welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Florentino, C.
Knauer, W.
Tikofsky, L.
Godden, S.
Caixeta, L.
Pena-Mosca, F.
Nydam, D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Voluminous milk production at dry off has been previously as­sociated with increased udder pressure, discomfort and pain in the early dry period. The use of acidogenic boluses has been de­scribed as beneficial in helping decrease milk production and udder pressure at dry off. Therefore, the objectives of this study were to evaluate the effects of the administration of acidogenic boluses before dry off on udder pressure, rear teat distance, milk leakage, as well as blood and urine pH during the first 2 weeks after dry off.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 234
